alert.note: Alert for Cottonwood; Murray (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 2:51AM CDT until May 30 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Murray County in southwestern Minnesota... Western Cottonwood County in southwestern Minnesota... * Until 315 AM CDT. * At 251 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage were located over Slayton, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These dangerous storms will be near... Fulda, Currie and Lake Shetek State Park around 300 AM CDT. Dovray around 305 AM CDT. Westbrook around 310 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Storden. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
